page.title: 06COUNTY HALL-GLENFIELD
page.content: {COUNTY HALL-}The administrative centre for Leicestershire is an impressive building standing in 50.648 acres of land. The original building,now called 'Penn-Lloyd Building', was constructed between March 1965 and November 1967 on what was then farmland,at a cost of Â£1,479,575. The original building did not have an official opening ceremony, it just came into use as most of the staff transferred from buildings in the city. A major extension,now called 'The Rutland Building', was begun in December 1972 at a cost of Â£308,777 for the preliminary contract and a further Â£1,324,913 when completed in December 1975. At this time the staff was increased by 300-500. A computer suite was added by 1973-cost Â£215,000. By June 1982,Central Purchasing Stores Warehouse and Distribution Depot was added-cost Â£597,304.
